intro: Hieracium pallidiflorum, commonly known as the paleflower hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. It features yellowish to pale yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium pallidiflorum is often found in temperate climates and is known for its low-growing, herbaceous structure.
